title: Your Core Values
description: Discover the 5 career values that matter most to you by ranking what truly drives your sense of fulfillment at work.

steps.title: What Really Matters to You?
steps.content: Imagine two job offers land on your desk tomorrow. Same pay, same title — but they feel completely different. What is it about one that pulls you in? That invisible pull? Those are your values talking, and most of us have never stopped to listen.

steps.title: Why Values Are Your Career Compass
steps.content: Values are the things that matter most to you — not what you think should matter, but what actually energizes you when it shows up in your work. Research from Acceptance and Commitment Therapy shows that when people align their actions with their values, they experience more meaning, less burnout, and greater resilience during tough times. Values aren't goals you check off. They're directions you move toward, like a compass heading. You can always take one more step toward creativity, or connection, or growth — there's no finish line. That's what makes them so powerful for career decisions.
steps.keyTakeaway: Values are directions you move toward, not destinations you arrive at — and clarity on yours makes every career decision easier.

steps.title: Rank Your Top 5 Values
steps.content: Below are 10 common career values. Read through all of them first, then rank just your top 5 from most important (1) to fifth most important (5). Go with your gut — there are no right answers here. If you're torn between two, ask yourself: if I could only have one of these in my next role, which would I choose?
steps.exercisePrompt: Rank your top 5 career values from most important to least important.

exerciseItems.label: Autonomy
exerciseItems.description: Freedom to make decisions and work independently

exerciseItems.label: Creativity
exerciseItems.description: Opportunities to innovate, design, or build new things

exerciseItems.label: Growth
exerciseItems.description: Continuous learning, skill-building, and personal development

exerciseItems.label: Impact
exerciseItems.description: Making a meaningful difference for others or the world

exerciseItems.label: Security
exerciseItems.description: Stable income, benefits, and predictable work environment

exerciseItems.label: Connection
exerciseItems.description: Strong relationships, teamwork, and sense of belonging

exerciseItems.label: Recognition
exerciseItems.description: Being acknowledged and appreciated for your contributions

exerciseItems.label: Challenge
exerciseItems.description: Solving hard problems and pushing your limits

exerciseItems.label: Flexibility
exerciseItems.description: Control over when, where, and how you work

exerciseItems.label: Purpose
exerciseItems.description: Work that aligns with a cause or mission you believe in

steps.title: Sit With What Came Up
steps.content: Take a moment to look at your top 5. Sometimes our rankings surprise us — and that surprise is information worth paying attention to.

reflectPrompts.prompt: Did anything about your ranking surprise you? What stood out?
How well does your current work reflect your #1 value?
Which of your top values feels most absent from your life right now?

steps.title: One Small Step Today
steps.content: Values only matter if you act on them. Pick one micro-action you can take today — even something that takes less than five minutes — to honor your top value.
steps.commitPrompt: Choose one small action you'll take today to move toward your #1 value:
commitOptions: Write down my top value and put it somewhere I'll see it daily
Tell someone I trust about the value that matters most to me
Identify one moment this week when I was living this value
